source: 211.org, Washington State Department of Veterans Affairs, and regional veteran organizations

resources.name: Washington State Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.address: 1102 Quince St. SE, PO Box 41150, Olympia, WA 98504-1150
resources.description: Main state agency providing comprehensive veteran benefits and services including housing, employment, education, mental health, legal assistance, and financial support

resources.name: Washington 211 Information & Referral
resources.description: Community services directory connecting veterans to housing, food, employment, mental health, healthcare, childcare, and emergency assistance

resources.name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) - Western Washington
resources.description: Catholic Community Services program providing housing assistance and support to veteran families experiencing homelessness in Western Washington counties

resources.name: SSVF Pierce County Office
resources.description: Pierce County regional office of SSVF providing housing and supportive services to veteran families

resources.name: King County Veterans Program
resources.description: County program helping veterans navigate systems and access essentials including identification, healthcare, housing, employment, food, and transportation

resources.name: Spokane County Veterans Services
resources.description: County agency providing emergency assistance, benefits assistance, and support services to Spokane County veterans

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free and confidential crisis support for veterans and their families

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: 24/7 free access to trained counselors for homeless veterans and at-risk veterans

resources.name: Columbia Basin Veterans Opportunity Center
resources.address: 1020 South 7th Avenue, Suite A, Pasco, WA 99301
resources.description: Veterans center providing housing, counseling, job search, mentoring, and benefits assistance in the Tri-Cities area

resources.name: Veterans Assistance Fund (Benton County)
resources.address: 7102 West Okanogan Place, Suite 201, Kennewick, WA 99336
resources.description: Financial assistance program for Benton County veterans with utility, rental, dental, burial, and childcare assistance

resources.name: First Avenue Center
resources.description: Provides benefits information, health care enrollment, and survivor benefits assistance for veterans

resources.name: VA Puget Sound Health Care System - Seattle Division
resources.description: Federal VA medical center providing comprehensive healthcare to enrolled veterans

resources.name: VA Puget Sound Health Care System - American Lake Division (Tacoma)
resources.description: Federal VA medical center serving Pierce County and surrounding areas with comprehensive healthcare

resources.name: Spokane Vet Center
resources.description: VA Vet Center providing readjustment counseling and mental health services to veterans

resources.name: Mann-Grandstaff VA Medical Center (Spokane)
resources.description: Major federal VA medical center providing 24/7 healthcare to enrolled veterans in Eastern Washington

resources.name: Tacoma Rescue Mission - Veterans Program
resources.description: Specialized shelter and support services for homeless veterans in the Tacoma area

resources.name: DAV Chapter No. 1 (Tacoma)
resources.description: Disabled American Veterans chapter providing service officer assistance and veteran advocacy

resources.name: VFW Service Division - Spokane
resources.address: 112 N University RD BLDG B, Spokane, WA 99206
resources.description: Veterans of Foreign Wars chapter providing service officer assistance and claims support

resources.name: American Legion - Spokane Service Office
resources.address: VA Medical Center, 4815 N Assembly Bldg 6A, Spokane, WA 99205
resources.description: American Legion chapter providing service officer assistance and veteran services

resources.name: Spokane Tribe Veterans Program
resources.description: Veteran services for Spokane Tribe members and veterans

resources.name: Office of Military and Veteran Legal Assistance
resources.description: State agency promoting civil legal assistance programs and pro bono services for veterans

resources.name: Northwest Justice Project Veterans Project
resources.description: Free legal services to low-income and homeless veterans for civil legal problems affecting housing, employment, and self-sufficiency

resources.name: Washington Veterans Bar Association
resources.description: Bar association providing legal assistance resources and pro bono services for veterans

resources.name: UW Law - Veteran Civil Legal Clinic (King County)
resources.address: University of Washington School of Law, Seattle, WA
resources.description: Law school clinic providing free legal services to veterans, service members, and families for VA benefits and civil matters

resources.name: Employment Security Department - Veteran Services
resources.description: State employment services providing job listings, referrals, hiring events, resume assistance, and skill assessments for veterans

resources.name: Veteran Readiness and Employment (VRE) Program
resources.description: Federal VA program providing vocational rehabilitation and employment services to veterans with service-connected disabilities

resources.name: Transition Assistance Program (TAP)
resources.description: Federal program assisting service members transitioning to civilian employment with workshops and career planning

resources.name: Washington Soldiers Home - Orting
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facility for eligible Washington veterans

resources.name: Washington Veterans Home - Port Orchard (Retsil)
resources.address: 1141 Beach Dr. E., Port Orchard, WA 98366
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facility with Women Veterans Wing for eligible Washington veterans

resources.name: Spokane Veterans Home
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facility for eligible Washington veterans

resources.name: Walla Walla Veterans Home
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facility for eligible Washington veterans
